chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charvon M Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: - Restitution set at $460.00 made payable to SH to be paid by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Pay supervision fees.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid using any cash bail on deposit. Anything left due and owing is to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Afer obtaining GED/HSED; Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

- No contact with firearms.
- Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No new law violations.
- No driving without a valid drivers license.
- No contact with SH and any other victim.

- Cooperate with agent. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program (Thinking for a Change).
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- Complete a letter of apology to SH and turn into agent.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- Complete a probation intake in a timely manner.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charvon M Coleman

records.addlTxt: Completion of Representation, Filed.

Defendant Charvon M Coleman in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Charvon M Coleman in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charvon M Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS ONE, THREE AND FIVE; Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Court ordered defendant to serve 142 days in the House of Correction, with 142 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Provide DNA Sample. Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 7/26/2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.

AS TO COUNT THREE; Court ordered defendant to serve 142 days in the House of Correction, with 142 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Provide DNA Sample. Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 7/26/2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.

AS TO COUNT FIVE; The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, with credit for 142 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program (Thinking for a Change).
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No driving without a valid drivers license.
- No contact with SH and any other victim.
- Complete a letter of apology to SH and turn into agent.
- Afer obtaining GED/HSED; Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Complete 25 HOURS of community service.
- No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Complete a probation intake in a timely manner.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $460.00 made payable to SH to be paid by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid using any cash bail on deposit. Anything left due and owing is to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court GRANTS expungement of this case upon successful completion of probation.
Received and Filed.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Charvon M Coleman not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Charvon M Coleman not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing.   Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defense requested a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, via zoom.  Defendant Charvon M Coleman not in court, in custody appearance waived.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court set bail at $4,000. Conditions of bail include No Contact with victims in this matter

Defendant Charvon M Coleman in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Charvon M Coleman in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charvon M Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Lori Rom, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, via zoom, defendant Charvon M Coleman not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court denied defense request and set bail at $4,000. cash with conditions of bail to include:  Turn over to Justice Point for Level 3 Supervision;  No Contact with victims in this matter; Absolute Sobriety and No Driving with out a valid license.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maiya L. W.; Risa L.C; Benediction Lutheran Church; Sharon L.H ;Pastor Donald T. H; Berea Lutheran Church and Pastor Jeffrey G. M

Defendant Charvon M Coleman in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Charvon M Coleman in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charvon M Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1-3.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense request a bail bond hearing. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d66d5f44-cf7a-0e03-96c5-92d4fbbd91a4  Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
